page.title: 15LEGEND- CLAY'S LIGHT.
page.content: Thomas Clay, a bachelor, lived in a hut one mile from Saint Andrews church Halton Holegate and was churchwarden for 1658, 1661, 1662. He walked across the fields to church (Clay's Walk) refusing to go by road. On his death, instructions were that his coffin be carried Clay's Walk to church, this wish being denied, his body taken by road. On the evening of the funeral day villagers saw a light travel Clays Walk, through the churchyard and settle on the church tower. It was said that when a village death was about to occur, this light shone above or near the house where death was imminent. RECTORY FOOTSTEPS: It was said that Dr. George Tennyson's footsteps (a visitor to Halton Rectory 1814-1831) could be heard in the 1960's and 70's.
